page.title: 12The Fete - Barby
page.content:
The following is taken from a report printed in the "Rugby Advertiser" on 27th June 1985.
Last Saturday, despite a cool and windy day, Barby 'Grande Fete' took place and proved a very lively and popular event. There were stalls selling cakes, sweets,plants, crafts and bric-a-brac and a variety of games of skill and chance for visitors to try. The swing boats proved a big attraction for the younger visitors. Adults enjoyed an interesting display of photographs of Barby, past and present. A display was put on by Barby School children. A pleasing total of seven hundred pounds was made for the Church Restoration Appeal.
